page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT: QUINTON
page.content: The{population}of Quinton, being about{3,000,}is divided equally between{service and civilian families. However, almost three quarters of the workers have jobs related to the {army base. The size of the village has doubled since the base opened and whilst bringing in soldiers, it has created jobs for some who have left farming. The local{farms}are now worked by a {mere handful}of tenants, owners and labourers, with additional, seasonal contract labour. Of the remaining workers, many work in{tourist trades in Stratford,}some {commute}to Coventry, Birmingham and other industrial and commercial centres.There are also a variety of {professions and businesses}represented in the village.
